title: Buck Clayton & Buddy Tate - 1974 - Kansas City Nights (vinyl
description:
Buck Clayton & Buddy Tate - 1974 - Kansas City Nights
Vinyl 24 bits 96 KHz

Count Basie-veterans Buck Clayton and Buddy Tate (the latter doubles on tenor and clarinet) are heard co-leading quintets throughout this two-LP set. With pianist Sir Charles Thompson, bassist Gene Ramey and either Mousie Alexander or Gus Johnson on drums, these small-group swing sets are a bit unusual in that, in addition to three standards, there are seven compositions by Clayton and three from Tate, none of which are well-known. The horn players are in good form investigating and swinging this fresh material. (AllMusic)

Track list:
Side 1
01 - High Life
02 - When A Woman Loves A Man
03 - Thou Swell
Side 2
04 - Can't We Be Friends
05 - Birdland Betty
06 - Kansas City Nights
Side 3
07 - Rompin' At Red Bank
08 - Blue Creek
09 - A Swinging Doll
10 - Dallas Delight
Side 4
11 - Don't Mind If I Do
12 - Blue Breeze
13 - Blue Ebony

Sides 1 and 2 originally issued as Buck and Buddy (1960 Prestiga/Swingville 2017); Sides 3 and 4 as Buck and Buddy Blow the Blues (1961 P/S-2030).
